Update: Fire is under control, contained to approximately 1/8 acre in brush and timber.  Initial start of the fire is believed to be an animal on the power line.  No injuries and no excavations from this fire.  Crews will be going back into service as mop-up is completed.
Update: First arriving crews on scene have resized this to 25’ X 25’ no structures are threatened and the fire is under control.  Crews working on mop-up. No injuries reported.

UPDATE 2500 blk of Farmcrest Drive: The fire is under control.

#FairfaxsBravest are on scene of a 3-alarm garden-style apt fire in 2500 blk of Farmcrest Dr in Frying Pan. Units arrived to fire showing from 2nd & 3rd floors. Working to confine/extinguish fire. No reported civilian injuries. 1 FF transferred w/ non-life-threatening injuries.

#FairfaxsBravest are on scene of a high-rise fire in 12000 blk of Town Square St, Reston. Units dispatched for fire alarm. Call upgraded for reports of smoke. Crews located fire on 8th floor that was contained by sprinkler system. Checking for extension/ventilation. No injuries.

Around 7pm #FairfaxBravest responded to reports of a vehicle stuck in water in the 9200 blk of Old Dominion Dr in Great Falls. Units arrived to find a vehicle stuck in swift water with 7 occupants trapped. Crews worked quickly to rescue the occupants. There were no injuries.

Good afternoon Toledo!! This is the second day of the Do’s and Don’ts of calling 9-1–1. This focuses on life-threatening emergencies. Remember if you are unsure, don’t take any chances and call for help.

Hello Toledo!!!
The Do's and Don'ts of calling 9-1-1. It's important that everyone knows the difference between an emergency and a non-emergency.

If you're ever unsure, don’t take any chances, call for help.

As we celebrate our nation's independence, we encourage everyone to enjoy the holiday with family and friends. Whether you're grilling, attending fireworks, or relaxing at home, remember to stay safe.

From all of us at Toledo Fire and Rescue Department, have a fun and be safe.

Today marks the official end of nearly 33 years dedicated to serving to the City of Toledo for Private Brett Langston. Thank you for your hard work over your career.  

On behalf of Chief Allison Armstrong and TFRD, Private Langston, congratulations  on your retirement.
